text.author: Ikan Kekek, Podrozniczek, Potwo-or and others (see URL)
text.title: Łódź
text.summary: This article goes over the history of Łódź, Poland's third biggest city with 760,000 people, its prosperity in the 19th century textile industry boom, the Nazi occupation in World War II which wiped out its Jewish population and killed many others, its subsequent dilapidation, and its recent campaigns to host film festivals and cultural events.
